title: A man buys 11 lemons for 10 rupees and sells 10 lemons for 11 rupees. What is his gain per cent? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friends..! A man buys 11 lemons for 10 rupees Cost price (CP) of each lemon = ₹10/11 He sells 10 lemons for 11 rupees. Selling price (SP) of each lemon = ₹11/10 Profit/Gain % = (SP - CP)/CP × 100 Profit/Gain % = (11/10 - 10/11)/10/11 ×100 = (121 - 100)/110 / 10/11× 100 = 21 × 100/110 × 11/10 = 2100/110 × 11/10 = 2100 × 11/1100 = 21% Answer his profit / gain percent is 21%

Cost price. Of 11 lemons = 10 Cost price of 1 lemon = 10/11 Selling price of 10 lemons = 11 Selling price of 1 lemon = 11/10 CP = 10/11 & SP = 11/10 Profit = SP- CP = (11/10) -(10/11) = (121–100)/110= 21/110 Profit % = profit/CP={ (21/110) /(10/11) } X 100 ={( 21/110 )X (11/10)} X 100= 21% Happy learning 🙂
